page.title: 16RIVER AXE AND RIVER YARTY
page.content: Two rivers flow through our area. The larger river is the Axe, and the other river is called the Yarty. Both are fairly small rivers, although they can become swollen after heavy rain and can cause flooding of the fields either side of their banks. The Yarty runs into the Axe near the end of its run, almost into the estuary of the Axe. There are mud flats, which are tidal at the estuary, and these are frequented by many different types of birds. The estuary is a popular place with birdwatchers. Sometimes we see herons and swans in the fields by the rivers when we are on our way to visit other schools.
